page.title: 04The Woodford Air Show
page.content: Many people crowded to Woodford to see the annual Woodford Air Show.This year was the special 60th anniversary show organised by the Royal Air Force Association for their charity.Approximately 75,000 plane spotters and flying enthusiasts were there with their picnic baskets to watch the display. The show was opened by Flight Lieutenant John Watts of the R.A.F in a Catalina Flying Boat.This was being shown at Woodford for the first time. Vulcan bombers made a welcome return to the show in a display with a Lancaster bomber.There was also the Battle of Britain Memorial flight,the Navy's Sea Fury and Sea Hawk and as usual a brilliant display by the Red Arrows.
